Develop and Scan.description: Film processing and digital copies of your images. Get your images via an easy download link to your email.

Film Format.accordion_title: What film format do I have?
Film Format.accordion_sub_title: Film comes in different shapes and sizes. Match your film to the kinds listed below when ordering.
Film Format.sub_title: Film comes in different shapes and sizes. Match your film to the kinds listed below when ordering.

options.label: Disposable
options.description: Your classic single use cam. We recycle them!

options.label: 35mm
options.description: The most common roll film, in a metal canister.
Medium format film, known for taller size and paper backing.
A smaller film size, inside of a black plastic cartridge.

options.label: 4x5 (Sheet)
options.description: A large-format single sheet offering high resolution, precise tonal control, and wide dynamic range.

options.label: 8x10 (Sheet)
options.description: Ultra-large format sheet film delivering exceptional detail, smooth tonal gradation, and maximum enlargement quality.

Process.accordion_sub_title: There is a process required to develop each film type. Check your film roll or camera for the following markings to order the best option for your images.
Process.sub_title: There is a process required to develop each film type. Check your film roll or camera for the following markings to order the best option for your images.

options.label: Color (C-41)
options.description: A process that results in a color negative. (Sometimes labeled as CN-16).

options.label: Black & White
options.description: A classic process that results in a black and white negative.

options.label: Color Positive (E-6 Slide)
options.description: Reversal process that yields color-positive transparencies with high contrast and accurate color.

options.label: CINE (ECN-2)
options.description: Motion-picture negative process using a rem-jet backing for smoother grain, wide dynamic range, and cinematic color.

Push or Pull.sub_title: Pushing/Pulling film changes the development time to make photos brighter or darker. We recommend selecting ‘Normal’.
Push or Pull.column_one_richtext:
What is Push/Pull and how it works?

All films behave differently depending on how much light they received during exposure. Therefore, each film profile in Dehancer Film in fact consists of 3 separate profiles. Each profile is defined by its own sampling conditions:

  • Normal exposure
  • Underexposed: Push/Pull = -2
  • Overexposed: Push/Pull = +2

Changes in the Push/Pull setting result in darker or lighter image, changing color and contrast – just like with real film. Film type defines the character of changes.

For expired film, we recommend Push +1 for each decade of expiration.

Scanning.accordion_title: Which scanner is right for me?
Scanning.accordion_sub_title: Both scanners create beautiful results, but each has unique strengths. See below for details and visual examples so you can select the best fit for your needs.
Scanning.column_one_richtext:
Noritsu HS-1800

  • Look & feel: Crisp, sharp detail with a slightly more neutral/modern colour profile.
  • Best for: When you want maximum fine detail, subtle tones, or need flexibility for editing.
  • Great with: Colour negative film, B&W film, and high-contrast scenes.
Scanning.column_two_richtext:
Fuji Frontier SP-3000

  • Look & feel: Smooth, rich colour with a softer, more filmic aesthetic straight out of the scan.
  • Best for: Natural skin tones, warm highlights, and that classic Frontier “glow.”
  • Great with: Portraits, wedding photography, and any film you want to look timeless.

Scanning Resolution.accordion_title: What scan size is right for me?
Scanning Resolution.accordion_sub_title: Scans are high-quality digital copies of your film. Different resolutions affect how you can use your images — from quick sharing to large-format printing. Choose the option that fits your project best.
Scanning Resolution.sub_title: Scans are high-quality digital copies of your film.

options.label: Medium (JPEG)
options.description: Great for most uses. Delivers print-ready images suitable for sharing online and small to medium-size prints.

options.label: High (JPEG)
options.description: Higher resolution files with more detail, ideal for larger prints or additional cropping.

options.label: High (TIFF)
options.description: Maximum available resolution for critical work, archiving, or professional needs.

Border Options.accordion_sub_title: Choose how you want your scans to be framed. We offer both white borders and sprocket-style borders for 35mm film.

options.label: White Border
options.description: Slight white gap between paper edge and photo.

options.label: Overscan (Sprockets)
options.description: Full bleed (no white border) for maximum frame coverage.

Add Ons - Contact Sheet Resolution.accordion_title: What resolution do you want for your contact sheet?
Add Ons - Contact Sheet Resolution.accordion_sub_title: Contact sheets are a great way to share your images with friends and family. Choose the resolution that fits your needs.

options.label: Small DPI (200)
options.description: Small resolution contact sheet, great for simple sharing.

options.label: Medium DPI (600)
options.description: Medium resolution contact sheet, good for more detailed views.

options.label: High DPI (1000)
options.description: High resolution contact sheet, best for archiving and zooming.

Develop Only.description: Film processing, without digital copies. For those that scan at home and are just looking for their negatives back.

Flextight Drum Scan.description: Ultra-sharp, high-resolution scans of your film for top-tier archival or print quality (only available in Atlanta).

Resolution.accordion_title: Which resolution is right for me?
Resolution.accordion_sub_title: Scans are high-quality digital copies of your film. Different resolutions affect how you can use your images — from quick sharing to large-format printing. Choose the option that fits your project best.

options.label: Regular
options.description: Standard full-optical scan (100mb) — great for general use.

options.label: High
options.description: High-detail scan at the upper optical limit (200mb) — ideal for large prints or archival-quality work.

options.label: Archival
options.description: Maximum resolution + bit depth (600mb) with 3F raw-style scan — perfect for preservation or re-editable scans.
